revised_title: Investigating the Strength of Wrought Iron Plates and Riveted Joints in Ship-Building
tldr: This paper by William Fairbairn investigates the strength of wrought iron plates and riveted joints in ship-building through a series of experiments. The author compares the tensile strength of different types of iron and timber, and concludes that iron is five times stronger than oak, making iron ships more secure and stronger than those built with timber.
